item.description:
NEW STUFF:
The 3D version of the movie starts at 7:00, so let's meet in front of the theater if it's nice out (inside the doors if it's cold) by 6:30. NOTE: The 3D version MAY cost an extra $3, per AMC's new rule. If you'd rather see the non-3D version, let me know in your RSVP so that I can take a consensus. The NON-3D version starts at 6:15, so we'd meet by 5:45 for that one. I'm open to either -- just let me know!

As always, please call me if you'd like to change your RSVP after 5:00 the day of the movie, if you get lost, if you are running late (so I know to wait for you).

I have small popcorn and small soda vouchers for $3 each that you can buy from me before the movie.

Hope to see you Tuesday!

--Dana


------------------

OLD STUFF:
After the impending mayhem of Knowing, I think we'll need something a bit lighter. How's about a war between animated Monsters Vs. Aliens??! (The Monsters are the good guys.) This is playing in 3D and normal-vision, so I'll try to schedule the 3D when I update the time.

Summary:
When California girl Susan Murphy is unwittingly clobbered by a meteor full of outer space gunk on her wedding day, she mysteriously grows to 49-feet-11-inches tall. Alerted to the threat of this new monster, the military jumps into action and Susan is captured and secreted away to a covert government compound. There, she is renamed Ginormica and placed in confinement with a ragtag group of other monsters: the brilliant but insect-headed Dr. Cockroach, Ph.D.; the macho half-ape, half-fish The Missing Link; the gelatinous and indestructible B.O.B.; and the 350-foot grub called Insectosaurus. Their confinement is cut short, however, when a mysterious alien robot lands on Earth and begins storming the country. In a moment of desperation, The President is persuaded by General W.R. Monger to enlist the motley crew of Monsters to combat the Alien Robot and save the world from imminent destruction.

The usual stuff:
We'll meet inside the theater doors (or outside if it's nice out) and then I can buy us all discounted tickets ($8.50 each for FMM members and their guests). I also have $3 vouchers each for small sodas and small popcorns (can be used towards a larger size). As always, guests are always welcome, just be sure to include them in the RSVP so that I know who to expect.

Please keep your RSVP as up-to-date as possible. And please call me if you're going to be late or need to change your RSVP after I close RSVPs on the site (2 hours before we meet). My cell is: 508/308-4897. I'm also good for directions if you get lost.

After the movie, we'll head to Fridays (I'll bring the coupons!) to chat about the movie (and just chat).

Hope to see you for Monsters Vs. Aliens!

--Dana
item.name: Monsters Vs. Aliens
